page.title: 15Traffic in and out
page.content: We carried out a census of traffic on the Kingsway, a dual carriageway running from east to west on the outskirts of Dundee and passing through our area of study. We watched the traffic at the junction with Coupar Angus Road. Of the traffic travelling north on the Coupar Angus Road the most common vehicle was the car. We felt that most of the travellers would be heading for Blairgowrie or Alyth or perhaps to some of the smaller villages on the way.Of the traffic heading south, again the majority were cars, and we thought they were probably heading into Dundee for work or shopping. What vans we saw were either Post Office vans delivering letters and parcels, or Securicor vans which patrol the factories in the area.
